t: The Law of the Lord Is Perfect
To the choirmaster. A Psalm of David.
The*pn heavens declare the glory of God, and*ld the sky above proclaims his handiwork.
Day*ln to day pours out speech, and*ld night to night reveals knowledge.
There*ln is no speech, nor are there words, whose*ld voice is not heard.
Their*ln voice goes out through all the earth, and*ld their words to the end of the world. In*ln them he has set a tent for the sun,
which*ld comes out like a bridegroom leaving his chamber, and,*ld like a strong man, runs its course with joy.
Its*ln rising is from the end of the heavens, and*ld its circuit to the end of them, and*ld there is nothing hidden from its heat.
The*pn law of the Lord*s is perfect, reviving*ld the soul; the*ln testimony of the Lord*s is sure, making*ld wise the simple;
the*ln precepts of the Lord*s are right, rejoicing*ld the heart; the*ln commandment of the Lord*s is pure, enlightening*ld the eyes;
the*ln fear of the Lord*s is clean, enduring*ld forever; the*ln rules of the Lord*s are true, and*ld righteous altogether.
More*ln to be desired are they than gold, even*ld much fine gold; sweeter*ln also than honey and*ld drippings of the honeycomb.
Moreover,*ln by them is your servant warned; in*ld keeping them there is great reward.
Who*pn can discern his errors? Declare*ld me innocent from hidden faults.
Keep*ln back your servant also from presumptuous sins; let*ld them not have dominion over me! Then*ln I shall be blameless, and*ld innocent of great transgression.
Let*pn the words of my mouth and the meditation of my heart be*ld acceptable in your sight, O*ld Lord,*s my rock and my redeemer.
